intro: Hippion heteroclita, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dandelion, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces yellow composite flowers that develop into elongated, slender seed heads. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional medicine.
